Description: THE WILDFIRE RISK REDUCTION PROGRAM (WRRP) PROJECTS TO BE FUNDED UNDER THIS AGREEMENT INCLUDE:GRANT PROGRAM THAT INCLUDES 1) COMMUNITY WILDFIRE PROTECTION PLAN (CWPP) UPDATES, 2) HAZARDOUS FUELS REDUCTION TREATMENTS, AND 3) EDUCATION AND OUTREACH PROJECTS: THE GRANT PROGRAM ASSISTS NEW MEXICO COMMUNITIES IN REDUCING RISK FROM WILDLAND FIRE ON NON-FEDERAL LANDS. THE GRANT PROGRAM IS ONLY APPLICABLE TO THE NEW MEXICO WILDLAND URBAN INTERFACE (WUI) AS DEFINED IN AN APPROVED CWPP. FUNDING IS INTENDED TO DIRECTLY BENEFIT COMMUNITIES THAT MAY BE IMPACTED BY WILDLAND FIRE INITIATING FROM OR SPREADING TO BLM PUBLIC LAND. PROJECTS NEED TO SHOW A DIRECT BENEFIT TO BLM. WILDFIRE URBAN FIRE SUMMIT (WUFS): WUFS BRINGS TOGETHER LOCAL, STATE, AND FEDERAL PARTNERS TO DISCUSS TOPICS SUCH AS, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, WILDFIRE STRATEGIES INCLUDING FIREWISE, FIRE ADAPTED COMMUNITIES, HOME ASSESSMENTS, PRESCRIPTION INITIATIVES, WILDFIRE RECOVERY, INVESTIGATIONS, SMOKE MITIGATION, MAPPING, WEATHER OUTLOOKS, AND PRE-FIRE POST-FIRE PLANNING. SPECIAL PROJECTS: THE NEW MEXICO ASSOCIATION OF COUNTIES (NMAC) WILL MONITOR SPECIAL PROJECTS THROUGHOUT THE DURATION OF THE PROJECT TIMELINE. SPECIAL PROJECTS WILL BE IDENTIFIED BY A BUREAU OF LANDS MANAGEMENT (BLM) REPRESENTATIVE THAT CAN INCLUDE FUEL TREATMENTS, EDUCATION AND OUTREACH PROJECTS, AND OTHER TYPES OF PROJECTS. NMAC AND BLM WILL WORK IN COORDINATION TO ENSURE SPECIAL PROJECTS ARE ON TASK AND COMPLETED IN A TIMELY MANNER.FUNDING BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE COUNTY GOVERNMENTS OR MUNICIPALITIES, NON-PROFITS, A STATUTORILY RECOGNIZED POLITICAL SUBDIVISION SUCH AS SOIL   WATER CONSERVATION DISTRICTS OR A NATIVE AMERICAN TRIBE WORKING ON BEHALF OF ONE OR MORE COMMUNITIES AT RISK OF WILDFIRES IN NEW MEXICO. GRANT PROGRAM RECIPIENTS CONTRIBUTE A 10  COST SHARE MATCH TO AN AWARD. IT IS THE RESPONSIBILITY OF GRANT PROGRAM AWARDEES TO COMPLY WITH APPLICABLE LOCAL, STATE, AND FEDERAL LAWS. APPLICANTS WHO RECEIVE MORE THAN  750,000 ANNUALLY FROM FEDERAL SOURCES ARE REQUIRED TO SUBMIT A COPY OF THEIR AUDIT TO NMAC. FUNDS CANNOT BE USED TO ATTEMPT TO INFLUENCE LEGISLATION OR THE OUTCOME OF ANY PUBLIC ELECTION.PROJECTS ASSIST BLM AND FURTHER CURRENT ADMINISTRATION AND OR DOI PRIORITIES BY HELPING TO CREATE RESILIENT LANDSCAPES AND COMMUNITIES, EXPAND COMMUNITY CAPACITY BY CREATING LOCAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES, SUPPORT AND PROMOTE PLANNING AND IMPLEMENTATION OF HAZARDOUS FUELS REDUCTION PROJECTS IN WUI AREAS, HELP CREATE FIRE ADAPTED COMMUNITIES, INCREASE RESILIENT LANDSCAPES, AND INCREASE COMMUNICATION, COLLABORATION AND EDUCATION OF, AND BETWEEN, LOCAL, STATE AND FEDERAL PARTNERS. PROJECTS PROVIDE WILDFIRE AWARENESS AND MITIGATION TECHNIQUES FOR NEW MEXICANS AS WELL AS OUT-OF-STATE TRAVELERS, BENEFIT OVERALL FOREST HEALTH, ENHANCE RECREATION OPPORTUNITIES, AND INCREASE COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT

FUNDING WILL BE UTILIZED TO ANNUALLY RE-ENGAGE LOCAL STAKEHOLDERS PROVIDING AN OPPORTUNITY TO REVIEW EXISTING AND PROPOSED POTENTIAL OPERATIONAL WILDFIRE DELINEATIONS (POD) BOUNDARY ADJUSTMENTS. IT WILL SUPPORT ANNUAL UPDATES, MAINTENANCE, AND HOSTING OF PODS FOR AGENCY AND PUBLIC USE. PARTNERS INCLUDE SOUTHERN OREGON FOREST RESTORATION COLLABORATIVE (SOFRC), OREGON DEPARTMENT OF FORESTRY, MEDFORD DISTRICT BLM AND ROGUE RIVER SISKIYOU NATIONAL FOREST. THIS COLLABORATIVE PROJECT WILL INCORPORATE INPUT FROM THE CITIZENS OF THE ROGUE VALLEY, AND LAND MANAGEMENT AND FIRE SUPPRESSION AGENCIES. FUNDING WILL ALSO BE USED TO PROVIDE SUPPORT AND DATA MANAGEMENT FOLLOWING 5 COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT SESSIONS LED BY SOFRC. PROJECT FUNDING TO UPDATE THE ROGUE VALLEY INTEGRATED WILDFIRE PLAN TO INCLUDE PODS WILL AID IN PRIORITIZING FUELS REDUCTION PROJECTS TO SUPPORT STRATEGIC WILDFIRE SUPPRESSION, AND PROMOTE FOREST RESILIENCY.
WIRE CENTER CO-PRODUCTION TOWARD FIRE-ADAPTED COMMUNITIES
ORWA IIJA ROGUE VALLEY PRESCRIBED BURN ASSOCIATION

THE PURPOSES OF THIS AWARD ARE TO: ASSIST THE BLM IDAHO FALLS DISTRICT OFFICE WORK COLLABORATIVELY WITH COMMUNITIES AND LANDOWNERS TO ADDRESS WILDFIRE RESILIENCY ON BLM LANDS AND PRIVATE LANDS IN SE IDAHO. PROVIDE EDUCATION TO COMMUNITIES AND LANDOWNERS IN THE WILDLAND URBAN INTERFACE TO IMPROVE THEIR RESILIENCY TO WILDFIRE, INCLUDING EDUCATION, DEFENSIBLE SPACE, FUELS REDUCTION, AND TO BE PREPARED TO EVACUATE IN THE EVENT OF A WILDFIRE. ASSIST RANCHERS AND FARMERS WORK COOPERATIVELY WITH FEDERAL, LOCAL, AND STATE AGENCIES, INCLUDING BLM TO IMPROVE WILDFIRE RESILIENCY TO RANGE AND WILDLIFE HABITAT ON A LANDSCAPE BASIS.

THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS AGREEMENT IS TO REDUCE THE RISK OF WILDFIRES IN THE COMMUNITIES OF ADA, ADAMS, BOISE, CANYON, ELMORE, GEM, OWYHEE, PAYETTE, VALLEY, AND WASHINGTON COUNTIES IN IDAHO WITHIN THE BOUNDARIES OF THE BOISE DISTRICT OF THE BUREAU OF LAND MANAGEMENT WHO HAVE MAJOR RISKS TO LOSS OF LIFE AND PROPERTY DUE TO DRY SUMMER CONDITIONS CREATING VERY HIGH IGNITION RATES OF EXCESSIVE HAZARDOUS FUELS. THE RC D COUNCIL WILL WORK CLOSELY WITH COMMUNITY LEADERS, HOME OWNER ASSOCIATIONS AND OTHER CITIZEN GROUPS TO IDENTIFY EXISTING PROBLEMS. THEY WILL THEN BRING TOGETHER THE LOCAL, STATE AND FEDERAL RESOURCES NEEDED TO DEVELOP COST EFFECTIVE PLANS TO REDUCE THE WILDFIRE RISK TO THE COMMUNITIES.
ID GREATER BOISE COMMUNITY WILDLAND FIRE FUELS MANAGEMENT
ORWA IIJA UPPER APPLEGATE WATERSHED PROJECT

THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO IMPLEMENT MORE, LARGER HAZARDOUS FUELS REDUCTION PROJECTS, HIRE A MITIGATION SPECIALIST TO MANAGE PROGRAMS, PERFORM COMMUNITY WILDFIRE RISK ASSESSMENTS, ASSIST WITH COUNTY CWPP UPDATE, IMPROVE FIREFIGHTER TRAINING CAPACITY AND SUSTAINABILITY, SUPPORT JOINT WILDLAND PROGRAM AND MITIGATION CREWS, CONTINUE TO DEVELOP WILDLAND FIRE PREPAREDNESS, PREVENTION AND EDUCATION PROGRAMS, ASSIST AND COLLABORATE WITH NEW WILDFIRE-CENTRIC ORGANIZATIONS IN NORTHWEST COLORADO.

THE EAGLE COUNTY WILDFIRE COLLABORATIVE (ECWC) AND  ROARING FORK VALLEY WILDFIRE COLLABORATIVE (RFVWC) PARTNER AGENCIES RECOGNIZE, ACCEPT, AND RESPECT THE DIFFERENCES IN MISSIONS, GOALS, AND OBJECTIVES OF EACH OTHER. HOWEVER, WILDFIRE DOES NOT RECOGNIZE OR RESPECT JURISDICTIONAL BOUNDARIES. THE ECWC AND RFVWC ALSO RECOGNIZE THAT A GROUP OF PEOPLE WITH SHARED GOALS CAN GET MORE ACCOMPLISHED IF THEY WORK TOGETHER. THEY THEREFORE AGREE TO WORK COLLABORATIVELY AND IN A COORDINATED FASHION TO ACHIEVE THE SHARED MISSION AND OBJECTIVES SOUGHT BY EACH COLLABORATIVE. BOTH GROUPS ARE AT A TURNING POINT IN RESPECT TO ACCELERATING THE PACE AND SCALE WITH WHICH THEY IMPLEMENT MITIGATION ACTIONS BUT LACK THE NECESSARY CAPACITY TO SUSTAIN THESE EFFORTS OVER TIME. FURTHER, MANY PARTNER ROLES IN EACH COLLABORATIVE ARE NOT WELL DEFINED, AND WORKING AGREEMENTS ARE INFORMAL IN NATURE. THIS MAKES ACCOUNTABILITY DIFFICULT, HINDERING EFFECTIVE COLLABORATION AND MITIGATION ACTION. TO OVERCOME THESE BARRIERS, AND TO SET MUTUAL GOALS AND PRIORITIES, UTILIZE EXISTING FOREST MANAGEMENT TOOLS AND LEGAL AUTHORITIES, AND ALIGN THEIR DECISIONS ON WHERE TO MAKE THE INVESTMENTS NEEDED TO ACHIEVE THE MISSION AND OBJECTIVES SET FORTH BY EACH COLLABORATIVE, IS NOW NECESSARY TO HIRE A SHARED COLLABORATIVE COORDINATOR DEDICATED TO BOTH THE ECWC AND RFVWC. GRANT FUNDING IS BEING SOUGHT TO SUPPLEMENT THIS POSITION AND IS LEVERAGED BY FUNDING FROM EAGLE AND PITKIN COUNTIES.

THE PURPOSE OF THE AWARD IS TO REDUCE HAZARDOUS WILDFIRE FUELS AROUND CRITICAL INFRASTRUCTURE THAT SERVES THE CITY OF GRAND JUNCTION AS WELL AS TO PROVIDE PROTECTION FOR ADJACENT HOMES, BUSINESSES, GOVERNMENT SERVICES, AND CRITICAL HABITAT. PROJECT AREAS ARE PRIMARILY IN THE GRAND JUNCTION FIRE DEPARTMENT SERVICE AREA, WITH THE EXCEPTION OF CITY OWNED CRITICAL INFRASTRUCTURE THAT MAY FALL OUTSIDE THESE BOUNDARIES. THESE PROJECT AREAS ARE PART OF A LARGER GOAL OF CREATING LANDSCAPE SCALE FIRE RESILIENCE IN HIGH RISK AREAS DEFINED BY THE MESA COUNTY CWPP. THESE PROJECTS ARE THE PRODUCT OF COLLABORATIONS BETWEEN SIX CITY OF GRAND JUNCTION DEPARTMENTS INCLUDING FIRE, POLICE, PARKS FORESTRY, UTILITIES, PUBLIC WORKS, THE PROJECT TEAM, AND FINANCE.

THE AWARD PURPOSE IS TO CREATE A STRATEGIC CROSS BOUNDARY FIRE BREAK THROUGH A PARTNERSHIP BETWEEN ASPEN FIRE PROTECTION DISTRICT (AFPD), PITKIN COUNTY OPEN SPACE AND  TRAILS (PCOST), AND THREE PARCELS OF PRIVATE LAND. AFPD HAS IDENTIFIED A 30 ACRE ZONE, INCLUDING THE 25 ACRE PCOST RED BUTTE RANCH OPEN SPACE PARCEL AND 5 ACRES OF PRIVATE PROPERTY, AS A POTENTIAL PINCH POINT FOR HIGH INTENSITY WILDFIRE TO SPREAD INTO THE ADJACENT HIGH FIRE RISK NEIGHBORHOOD. WITHIN THOSE 30 ACRES, APPROXIMATELY 9.5 OVERGROWN ACRES REQUIRE FUELS REDUCTION TREATMENT TO TRANSFORM THE AREA INTO A COMMUNITY FIRE BREAK. REDUCING OVERGROWN AND DEAD VEGETATION IN THIS AREA REDUCES RISKS NOT ONLY TO ADJACENT COMMUNITIES BUT WOULD ALSO PROVIDE FIREFIGHTERS WITH A LINE OF DEFENSE BETWEEN THE LOCAL WILDLAND AREA AND POPULATED NEIGHBORHOOD TO SAFELY COMBAT A WILDFIRE. IMPORTANTLY TO THE OPEN SPACE PROGRAM, THIS PROJECT ALSO PROVIDES HABITAT IMPROVEMENT AND AN IMPORTANT RIVER ADJACENT TRAVEL CORRIDOR FOR LOCAL WILDLIFE.

THE FUELS MITIGATION PROJECT WILL REMOVE THE 40 YEAR ACCUMULATION OF SLASH AND DEBRIS AND THIN TREES, BRUSH AND REDUCE LADDER FUELS TOCREATE BUFFERS OF ABOUT 30 100 FEET FOR HOMES ADJACENT TO THE OPEN SPACES.VARIABLE DENSITY THINNING WILL BE USED TO LEAVE A MOSAIC WELL SPACED ISLANDS OF VEGETATION TO MAINTAIN SHADED AREAS FOR WILDLIFE HABITAT. ACCESS, TOPOGRAPHY AND FUELS TYPE AND LOADING VARY SIGNIFICANTLY BETWEEN OPEN SPACES TO BE TREATED.

THE LANDER COUNTY FUELS MANAGEMENT PROJECT S MISSION IS TO REDUCE THE THREAT OF WILDFIRE IN THE WILDLAND URBAN INTERFACE  THE BUREAU OF LAND MANAGEMENT HAS INITIATED HAZARD MITIGATION BY IMPLEMENTING FUEL REDUCTION TREATMENTS AND ESTABLISHING GREEN STRIPS IN HIGH HAZARD AREAS  IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE LANDER COUNTY FIRE PLAN  LCFP , THIS PROJECT WILL IMPLEMENT LCFP RECOMMENDATIONS INCLUDING CREATION OF NEW FUEL BREAKS AND MAINTENANCE OF EXISTING FUEL BREAKS TO SLOW THE ADVANCE OF AN ONCOMING WILDFIRE AND PROVIDE A PLACE WHERE FIREFIGHTER CAN DEFEND THE COMMUNITIES WITHIN THE SCOPE OF THIS PROJECT, LANDER COUNTY WILL WORK WITH THE NEVADA FIELD OFFICE OF THE BLM TO CREATE A DEVELOPMENT AND MANAGEMENT PLAN FOR THE ESTABLISHMENT AND MAINTENANCE OF A NETWORK OF ROADSIDE FUEL BREAKS TO REDUCE FIRE SPREAD AND PROTECT INVESTMENTS IN HABITAT RESTORATION AND CRITICAL RESOURCES ALONG WITH WILDLIFE HABITAT RESTORATION THROUGH PJ THINNING, INVASIVE ANNUAL GRASS REDUCTION AND RESTORATION, AND RIPARIAN HABITAT BENEFITING ACTIVITIES  THE LANDER COUNTY ROADS DEPARTMENT WILL PARTNER WITH THE BLM TO BUILD OFF EXISTING ROADS MAINTAINED BY THE COUNTY AND IMPLEMENT FUEL BREAKS AND FUELS REDUCTION ACTIVITIES  ADDITIONALLY, WORK WILL TAKE PLACE TO IDENTIFY AND IMPLEMENT RESTORATION PROJECTS ON CRITICAL SAGE GROUSE AND MULE DEER AREAS, WHILE INCREASING RECREATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES FOR THE PUBLIC THIS PROJECT BENEFITS THE PUBLIC BY IMPLEMENTING STRATEGIES THAT PROTECT COMMUNITIES AND INFRASTRUCTURE  ENHANCING, RESTORING, OR MAINTAINING RANGELAND PLANT COMMUNITIES AND HABITATS  FOSTERING AND PROMOTING FUELS MANAGEMENT AND COMMUNITY ASSISTANCE, COORDINATION, COOPERATION, AND PARTNERSHIPS  PLANNING AND IMPLEMENTING EFFECTIVE FUELS TREATMENT STRATEGIES THAT ENSURE RESILIENT LANDSCAPES, EMPHASIZES EFFECTIVENESS AS IT RELATES TO MITIGATING WILDFIRE IMPACTS, AND HELPS PROVIDE A SAFE AND EFFECTIVE RESPONSE TO WILDFIRE THE BLM RECEIVES THE INDIRECT BENEFIT OF THIS PROJECTS ACTIVITIES AS THIS PROJECT MEETS THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF BLM NEVADA S FUELS MANAGEMENT AND COMMUNITY FIRE ASSISTANCE PROGRAM  IN ADDITION TO MEETING THESE GOALS, THE LOCAL COMMUNITY COST SHARES THE MAJORITY OF THE PROJECT COST AND MAINTAINS AND PROTECTS BLM S EXISTING INVESTMENT IN FUEL BREAKS, HABITAT RESTORATION, AND CRITICAL RESOURCES IN RURAL NEVADA DURING THE PERIOD OF PERFORMANCE OF THIS PROJECT, WE ANTICIPATE TREATING 5,000 10,000 ACRES FOR FUELS REDUCTION AND WILDLIFE RESOURCES

THE PURPOSE OF THE AWARD IS TO COORDINATE AND CARRY OUT FUELS MANAGEMENT ON BLM ADMINISTERED LANDS OR LANDS BENEFITING BLM LANDS, ESPECIALLY IN THE WILDLAND URBAN INTERFACE, AND TO CARRY OUT WILDFIRE AWARENESS AND DEFENSIBLE SPACE EDUCATION, OUTREACH, AND SUPPORT ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED  FUELS MANAGEMENT IN CLOSE COORDINATION WITH BLM  THIS INCLUDED INVENTORY AND MAPPING OF HAZARDOUS FUELS, TREATMENT OF FUELS IDENTIFIED GIVEN THE TIME AND FUNDING CONSTRAINTS, REPORTING OF ALL TREATMENTS AND MAPPING, AND PROVIDING OUTREACH, EDUCATION, AND SUPPORT TO LANDOWNERS AND HOMEOWNERS FOR WILDFIRE AWARENESS, PREPAREDNESS, AND DEFENSIBLE SPACE  THE LOCAL FIREWISE SITE AND FIRE PROFESSIONALS WILL BE INCLUDED AND COORDINATED WITH IN ALL THESE ACTIVITIESEXPECTED DELIVERABLES OR OUTCOMES  AT THE BEGINNING OF EACH YEAR S TREATMENTS SEASON, WE WILL COORDINATE WITH BATTLE MOUNTAIN BLM AND LANDOWNERS AND HOMEOWNERS TO DEVELOP AN ANNUAL WORK PLAN AND IDENTIFY PRIORITY INVENTORY AND TREATMENTS FOR THE UPCOMING SEASON  RECORDS IN THE FORMAT BLM DESIRES WILL BE COMPLETED FOR EACH TREATMENT PERFORMED  ALL INVENTORIES AND TREATMENTS WILL BE RECORDED WITH GPS  ALL TREATMENT REPORTS AND INVENTORY RECORDS WILL BE REPORTED TO BLM BY THE END OF EACH CALENDAR YEAR EDUCATIONAL MATERIALS PROVIDED TO LANDOWNERS AND HOMEOWNERS WILL BE ALSO DEVELOPED AND DISTRIBUTED IN COORDINATION WITH BLM AND THE LOCAL EUREKA COUNTY FIREWISE SITE AND LOCAL FIRE PROFESSIONALS  BLM WILL RECEIVE A COPY OF ALL THESE MATERIALS AND THE EFFORTS COMPLETED WILL BE DOCUMENTED AND REPORTED TO BLM BY THE END OF EACH CALENDAR YEAR INTENDED BENEFICIARIES  ALL LAND USES AND LAND USERS OF BLM ADMINISTERED LANDS, ESPECIALLY THOSE WITHIN THE WILDLAND URBAN INTERFACE  THIS WOULD INCLUDE WILDLIFE AND OTHER BIOTIC RESOURCES

THIS PROJECT IS A REQUEST FOR FUNDING TO PROTECT THE COMMUNITIES OF FOREST LAKES, TWEEN, ENCHANTED FOREST, LOS RANCHITOS, AND THE SWEETWATER AREA ALONG WITH CRITICAL WATERSHED ENCOMPASSING THE NORTH AND SOUTH FORKS OF TEXAS CREEK  THIS PROJECT AS STATED IN THE NOTICE OF FUNDING LOOKS TO MEET  GOAL 1 PLANNING AND IMPLEMENTING STRATEGIES TO PROTECT COMMUNITIES AND INFRASTRUCTURE INCLUDING HABITATS  GOAL 3 FOSTERING AND PROMOTING FUELS MANAGEMENT IN A PARTNERSHIP WITH FEDERAL, LOCAL GOVERNMENT, AND PRIVATE PROPERTY OWNER  GOAL 5 COORDINATING WITH LANDOWNERS AND COOPERATORS FOR FUEL TREATMENTS ACROSS LANDSCAPES  AND GOAL 6 TO ENHANCE LOCAL AND SMALL BUSINESS EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES  THIS PROJECT IS A PARTNERSHIP WITH PUBLIC, PRIVATE, AND LOCAL GOVERNMENT TO FOSTER AND PROMOTE FUELS MANAGEMENT AND TREATMENT TO MAKE THE LANDSCAPE RESILIENT  THIS PROJECT ALSO REQUESTS FUNDING TO UPDATE FOUR  4  COMMUNITY WILDFIRE PROTECTION PLANS  CWPP  AND COMPLETE AN IN PROGRESS CWPP TO FACILITATE PLANNING AND IMPLEMENTING STRATEGIES TO PROTECT COMMUNITIES IN THE PROJECT AREA  THE PROJECT IS TO MITIGATE APPROXIMATELY 1500 ACRES OVER A FIVE YEAR PERIOD ON BOTH PRIVATE AND PUBLIC LANDS
CO EQUITABLE AND ACCESSIBLE MITIGATION PROGRAM
CO COMMUNITY ASSISTANCE PROGRAM WILDFIRE MITIGATION

THIS PROJECT PROPOSES TO REDUCE THE EXCESSIVE AND DANGEROUSLY DRY NATURAL FUEL LOAD ON APPROXIMATELY 20 ACRES IN AND AROUND THE TOWN OF COLLBRAN  LOCATED IN MESA COUNTY  AN INDEPENDENT CONTRACTOR OR CONTRACTORS WILL BE HIRED AND ASKED TO PRIORITIZE HIGH RISK AREAS WITHIN THE IDENTIFIED AREAS AND PERFORM WILDFIRE RISK ASSESSMENTS AND MITIGATION USING MECHANICAL THINNING, SEEDING AND REVEGETATION, EROSION CONTROL, PRUNING, AND HERBICIDE APPLICATION

THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO INCREASE SURVIVABILITY AND REDUCE RISK TO WILDFIRE IN THE COMMUNITY OF INDIAN SPRINGS THROUGH STRATEGIC FUELS TREATMENTS ALONG EVACUATION ROUTE, GENERAL ROADWAYS INSIDE THE COMMUNITY, EXPANSION OF PISTOL TURNAROUNDS, IDENTIFICATION OF SIGNIFICANT WATER SOURCES IN THE AREA, AND OTHER ACTION ITEMS IDENTIFIED IN THE INDIAN SPRINGS LANDOWNERS ASSOCIATION COMMUNITY WILDFIRE PROTECTION PLAN  CWPP   SPECIFIC MEASURES WILL BE TREE TRIMMING   CUTTING, CHIPPER RENTAL FOR FUELS REDUCTION, AND CUTTING BACK FUELS FROM THE SIDES OF THE ROADWAY ON THE 11 MILES OF ROADWAY THAT SERVES THE AREA
TREAT HAZARDOUS FUEL IN TWO WATERSHEDS, THE MCKENZIE RIVER WATERSHED AND THE MIDDLE FORK OF THE WILLAMETTE WATERSHED

WILDFIRE HAZARD AND RISK ARE INCREASING IN ALASKA DUE TO THE GROWTH OF BOTH WILDFIRE ACTIVITY ANDHUMAN POPULATION IN THE LAST FEW DECADES  THEREFORE, THERE IS THE NEED FOR TOOLS TO HELP MAKEINFORMED DECISIONS ABOUT HOW TO REDUCE WILDFIRE HAZARDS AND MINIMIZE POTENTIAL RISKS TORESIDENTS AND COMMUNITIES  THIS PROJECT WILL PRODUCE AN UPDATED STATEWIDE WILDFIRE HAZARD MAPTHAT INCORPORATES RECENT WILDFIRE ACTIVITY AND SUBSEQUENT CHANGES IN VEGETATION THAT INFLUENCE FUELABUNDANCE  GIVEN THE WIDESPREAD USE OF LANDFIRE VEGETATION BY THE WILDFIRE COMMUNITY WE WILLCOMPARE RESULTS FROM OUR APPROACH, WHICH USES VEGETATION DATA DEVELOPED BY NASA, WITH THELANDFIRE VEGETATION  THIS WILL HELP RELATE OUR PRODUCT AND TOOL TO A KNOWN STANDARD USED BYDECISION MAKERS  OUR WILDFIRE HAZARD MAPS HAVE SHOWN PROMISE IN HELPING TO PLAN FUELTREATMENTS AND DEVELOPING COMMUNITY WILDFIRE PROTECTION PLANS AND THERE IS THE NEED TO WIDELYDISTRIBUTE THIS INFORMATION  WE WILL WORK WITH THE BUREAU OF LAND MANAGEMENT AND OTHERAGENCIES TO CO DEVELOP AN ONLINE MAPPING PLATFORM THAT ALLOWS USERS TO VISUALIZE WILDFIREHAZARDS IN A MANNER THAT IS USEFUL TO THEM FOR MAKING DECISIONS

THE PURPOSE OF THE AWARD IS FUNDING FOR THE FIFTH BIENNIAL STUDENT CONGRESS, SPONSORED AND CONDUCTED BYA PARTNERSHIP AMONG THE ANDRUS CENTER FOR PUBLIC POLICY  ANDRUS CENTER , THE PUBLIC LANDS FOUNDATION PLF , AND THE NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF FOREST SERVICE RETIREES  NAFSR   ALL THREE ORGANIZATIONS ARENONPROFIT AND TAX EXEMPT UNDER INTERNAL REVENUE CODE 501 C  3   STAFF FROM THE NATIONAL INTERAGENCYFIRE CENTER ARE ALSO HELPING TO PLAN THE EVENT, ALONG WITH ACADEMICS AND BOISE STATE UNIVERSITY  BSU PERSONNEL

THE GOAL OF THIS PROJECT IS TO IMPROVE SURVIVABILITY OF PEOPLE, HOMES, AND LANDSCAPES WHEN WILDFIRE OCCURS IN DOUGLAS COUNTY, OREGON  THE PROJECT OBJECTIVES ARE TO   IMPROVE GIS DATA AND MAPS USED BY EMERGENCY RESPONDERS AND THE PUBLIC DURING A WILDFIRE EVENT   IMPROVE ACCESS FOR O FIRE FIGHTERS ALONG ROADS AND DRIVEWAYS  ANDO EVACUATION ROUTES   CREATE SAFE AND DEFENSIBLE LANDSCAPES AND COMMUNITIES BY REDUCING FUELS ON PRIVATE AND PUBLIC LANDS   PROMOTE WILDFIRE AWARENESS AND PUBLIC SAFETY BY PROVIDING TRAINING IN WILDFIRE PREPAREDNESS, DEFENSIBLE SPACE, AND WILDFIRE MITIGATION   SUPPORT AND ENHANCE THE ROLES AND FUNCTIONS OF THE COUNTY S FIRE DISTRICTS, DOUGLAS FOREST PROTECTIVE ASSOCIATION, COOS FOREST PROTECTIVE ASSOCIATION, BLM, USFS, AND WESTERN LANE DISTRICT  OREGON DEPARTMENT OF FORESTRY AND FIRE AND EMERGENCY SERVICE PROVIDERS

THE PROJECT IS INTENDED TO INCREASE FIRE PREPAREDNESS AND SUPPRESSION CAPACITY ON BOTH PUBLIC AND PRIVATE LANDS  THE PRIMARY FOCUS IS THE MITIGATION OF WILDFIRE IMPACTS THROUGH ACTIVITIES THAT ENHANCE COMMUNICATION AND INFORMATION SHARING, IMPROVE, AND MAINTAIN FIRE RELATED INFRASTRUCTURE  FIRE WATER SOURCES, WEATHER STATIONS, DETECTION CAMERAS, COMMUNICATION TOWERS , IMPROVE ACCESS FOR FIRE RESPONSE, REDUCE HAZARDS AND EDUCATE THE PUBLIC  THIS OBJECTIVE WILL BE MET BE IMPLEMENTING HAZARDOUS FUELS REDUCTION PROJECTS AND PROJECTS OUTLINES IN THE UPDATED 2021 LANE COUNTY WILDFIRE PROTECTION PLAN  CWPP

THIS PROJECT PROPOSES TO ACCOMPLISH FUELS REDUCTION   ON NON FEDERAL LANDS WITH ADJACENCY TO OR WITH BENEFIT TO BLM LANDS WITHIN   DESCHUTES COUNTY  FUNDS WILL BE   UTILIZED FOR CONTRACTUAL FUELS REDUCTION THROUGH THE USE OF CONTRACTORS AND   THROUGH AGREEMENTS WITH LANDOWNERS  THE PROJECT WILL TARGET TREATMENT ON   APPROXIMATELY 200 ACRES OF NON FEDERAL LANDS ADJACENT TO OR WITH DIRECT   BENEFIT TO BLM LANDS  ACTIVITIES WOULD INCLUDE TREE THINNING, PRUNING AND BRUSH   MOWING, MASTICATION, OR REMOVAL  THIS PROJECT WILL COMPLEMENT BLM TREATMENTS   OCCURRING ON BLM LANDS WITH THE END RESULT OF REDUCING EXPECTED FIRE   BEHAVIOR, INCREASING BOTH FIREFIGHTER AND COMMUNITY SAFETY
REDUCE   THE RISK AND IMPACT OF WILDFIRE TO LOCAL COMMUNITIES, TO INCREASE COMMUNITY   RESILIENCE TO WILDLAND FIRES, AND IMPROVE FOREST HEALTH
MT DAK SURVIVABLE SPACE INITIATIVE WILDFIRE MITIGATION RAPID CITY  SD

BRICC PROJECT TRAINING PROGRAMS WILL PROVIDE BLM OPERATORS, PARTNERS, LANDOWNERS, AND COOPERATORS NEW, STANDARDIZED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND COMPETENCIES TO AID THEM IN MONITORING CONSERVATION ACTIVITIES, THROUGH ONGOING AND TIMELY COLLECTION OF NECESSARY, PRECISE, AND ACCURATE DATA FOR CONTINUOUS IMPROVEMENT AND ADAPTATION OF STRATEGIES THAT DIRECTLY OR INDIRECTLY BENEFIT THE BLM  WHEN COMMUNITIES LIKE THAT OF THE COLUMBIA RIVER SCENIC AREA IMPROVES THEIR ABILITY TO MONITOR, ASSESS, AND INTERVENE OR IMPLEMENT IN CONSERVATION TACTICS, THEY CHANGE THE WAY IN WHICH THEY ENGAGE WITH AGENCIES LIKE BLM, AND ARE BETTER ABLE TO CONTRIBUTE TO THE BODY OF BEST PRACTICES AND DATA THAT WILL STRENGTHEN BLM AND DOI ABILITY TO FULFILL ITS MISSION AND ACHIEVE ITS PRIORITIES ACROSS THE NATION  THE BRICC PROJECT THUS HAS THE POTENTIAL TO BE A PART OF THE NATIONAL SOLUTION TO CHALLENGES PRECIPITATED BY CLIMATE CHANGE
BUREAU OF LAND MANAGEMENT CALIFORNIA FUELS MANAGEMENT AND COMMUNITY FIRE ASSISTANCE
BUTTE COUNTY FOREST HEALTH AND HAZARD FUELS AGREEMENT

THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROPOSED PROJECT IS TO PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE AND COST SHARE FUNDING FOR HAZARDOUS FUELS REDUCTION TREATMENTS ON NON FEDERAL PARCELS  TREATMENTS FUNDED THROUGH THIS PROJECT WILL OCCUR ON PRIORITY AREAS ADJACENT TO ACTIVE FOREST MANAGEMENT ON BLM PARCELS ASSOCIATED WITH THE BLM MISSOULA FIELD OFFICE CLARK FORK FACE PROJECT  HAZARDOUS FUEL REDUCTION ACTIVITIES PERFORMED IN ASSOCIATION WITH THIS PROJECT WILL REDUCE THE SPREAD AND INTENSITY OF WILDLAND FIRES ON NON FEDERAL LAND BY DECREASING THE PROBABILITY OF A STAND REPLACING CROWN FIRE AND REDUCING LADDER FUELS BY THINNING, PRUNING, AND TREATING SLASH  WITHIN THE PROJECT AREA, THE HOME IGNITION ZONE AND INGRESS EGRESS ALONG ACCESS ROADS WILL BE PRIORITIZED FOR TREATMENT  PROJECT OUTCOMES AND EXPECTED DELIVERABLES WILL INCLUDE TREATMENT OF HAZARDOUS FUELS ON  50 ACRES OF NON FEDERAL LAND AND THE DELIVERY OF OUTREACH EDUCATION THROUGH TARGETED MARKETING CAMPAIGNS AND IN PERSON EVENTS   15 THROUGHOUT THE DURATION OF THE PROJECT   FOLLOWING PROJECT COMPLETION AND FOR YEARS TO COME, THE BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROPOSED PROJECT WILL INCLUDE THE LOCAL COMMUNITY WHICH WILL HAVE A REDUCED WILDFIRE RISK, AS WELL AS IMPROVED EVACUATION SUCCESS AND FIRST RESPONDER ACCESS DURING A WILDFIRE

THE CALIFORNIA FIRE SAFE COUNCIL S  CFSC  MISSION IS TO SERVE AS CALIFORNIA S LEADERS IN COMMUNITY WILDFIRE RISK REDUCTION AND RESILIENCY AND SUPPORTS LOCALIZED EFFORTS IN COMMUNITY WILDFIRE PREPAREDNESS, EDUCATION, AND MITIGATION TO BUILD FIRE ADAPTED AND RESILIENT COMMUNITIES THROUGHOUT THE STATE  UNCONTROLLABLE AND EXTREME WILDFIRES ARE DEVASTATING TO PEOPLE, BIODIVERSITY, AND ECOSYSTEMS  IN CALIFORNIA, WE KNOW THIS REALITY ALL TOO WELL, WITH HOTTER, MORE INTENSE, AND FREQUENT WILDFIRES WORSENING  THE 2021 CALIFORNIA WILDFIRE SEASON HAD OVER 8,600 FIRES BURN CLOSE TO 2 5 MILLION ACRES ACROSS THE STATE

OPERATE AND EXTEND A FIRE MONITORING CAMERA NETWORK THAT IS AN END-TO-ENDFUNCTIONING SYSTEM OF INTEGRATED COMMUNICATIONS, DATA MANAGEMENT, DATA ACCESS, AND PUBLIC INTERACTION;(II) ALLOW MULTI-AGENCY USE OF A WEB-BASED, PUBLICLY VIEWABLE PLATFORM THAT PROVIDES USE FOR RESPONSE,DETECTION, FIRE MODELING, AND FUELS-MANAGEMENT OVERSIGHT; (III) PROVIDE TOOLS FOR FIRE DISCOVERY ANDRESPONSE IN OREGON AND WASHINGTON, INCLUDING FIRE AND SMOKE DETECTION AND ON DEMAND TIME LAPSE, LIVEVIEW,AND A.I.-DRIVEN DETECTION OF FIRE STARTS; AND (IV) SUPPORT FIRE MODELING THAT INCORPORATES CAMERAIMAGERY AND THE STATE OF THE ENVIRONMENT FOR EFFICIENT AND COST SAVING MEASURES, AS WELL AS FIRE FIGHTERSAFETY, FOR FIRE RESPONSE AND SUPPRESSION.
TO DEVELOP AN INTEGRATED WILDLAND FIRE EDUCATION, TRAINING, AND EXPERIENTIAL LEARNING PROGRAM THAT WOULD PREPARE STUDENTS FOR PROFESSIONAL FIRE MANAGER POSITIONS IN FEDERAL (AND OTHER) AGENCIES.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO PROVIDE SUPPORT   TOOLS FOR BLM FUELS MANAGEMENT AND COMMUNITY FIRE ASSISTANCE THROUGH THE   MAINTENANCE AND UPDATE OF THE ALL-LANDS EXPLORER, SOCIALIZING POTENTIAL   OPERATIONAL DELINEATION (PODS) AND UPDATING AND PROVIDING METRICS OF PERFORMANCE   FOR THE ROGUE BASIN COHESIVE FOREST RESTORATION STRATEGY (RBS).
REDUCING FIRE RISK CAUSED BY INVASIVE PLANTS IN THE SONORAN DESERT OF SOUTHERN ARIZONA THROUGHCROSS-JURISDICTIONAL COLLABORATION, TREATMENT CAPACITY BUILDING, OUTREACH AND EDUCATION.

THIS PROJECT IS A CAMPAIGN TO EDUCATE COLORADO RESIDENTS ABOUT THE DIFFERENCES IN SMOKE BETWEEN A PRESCRIBED FIRE AND A WILDLAND FIRE THAT WILL BRAND SMOKE FROM PRESCRIBED FIRE AS GOOD OR SAFE SMOKE AND CREATE A POSITIVE ASSOCIATION WITH THIS RISK REDUCTION EFFORT.

UNDER THE GOOD NEIGHBOR AUTHORITY, FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE ELIGIBILITY IS LIMITED TO STATES, COUNTIES, AND FEDERALLY RECOGNIZED INDIAN TRIBES. COLORADO STATE OFFICE OF THE BUREAU OF LAND MANAGEMENT (BLM) SEEKS TO ENGAGE COOPERATORS TO SUPPORT HAZARDOUS FUELS REDUCTION ACTIVITIES ON PUBLIC AND PRIVATE LANDS ALONG THE WILDLAND-URBAN INTERFACE (WUI) TO REDUCE THE RISK TO RESOURCES ON BOTH FEDERAL AND PRIVATE LANDS FROM WILDFIRE. REDUCING THE RISK OF WILDFIRE TO COMMUNITIES, PROPERTY, WILDLIFE, AND CRITICAL INFRASTRUCTURE IS ESSENTIAL TO PUBLIC AND FIREFIGHTER SAFETY.

THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS TO REDUCE THE RISK AND IMPACT OF WILDFIRE IN BLAINE, CAMAS, CASSIA, GOODING, JEROME, LINCOLN, MINIDOKA, AND TWIN FALLS COUNTIES THROUGH WILDFIRE PROTECTION PLANNING, HAZARDOUS FUELS REDUCTION, MAINTENANCE AND MONITORING, MITIGATION PROGRAMS, PUBLIC EDUCATION, AND ENHANCING LOCAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES.THIS AGREEMENT WILL EXPAND OPPORTUNITIES TO EDUCATE THE PUBLIC ON COMBUSTIBLE VEGETATION MANAGEMENT, STRUCTURAL IGNITION PREVENTION, AND SURVIVABLE SPACE. THE PROGRAMS AND ACTIONS ON THIS AGREEMENT WILL CONTINUE TO FOSTER PREPARATION AND ACTION THAT SAVES LIVES AND PROPERTY.

COUNTY-WIDE INTEGRATED WILDLAND URBAN INTERFACE FIRE PROGRAMMING INTENDED TO ALLOW COOPERATING ENTITIES TO ENHANCE AND CREATE CAPACITY WITHIN (12) FIRE DEPARTMENTS AND RURAL FIRE DISTICTS ACROSS BAKER COUNTY, WHILE UTILIZING COHESIVE WILDFIRE STRATEGY GOALS OF RESTORING AND MAINTAINING FIRE RESILISENT LANDSCAPES; CREATING FIRE ADAPTED COMMUNITITES AND RESPONDING TO WILDFIRE.

THE WILDLAND URBAN INTERFACE (WUI) COMMUNITY ASSISTANCE PROGRAM WAS SET UP TO PROVIDE ASSISTANCE TO COMMUNITIES AT RISK FROM WILDLAND FIRES IN SUPPORT OF THE NATIONAL FIRE PLAN. PROJECTS WILL IMPLEMENT THE NATIONAL FIRE PLAN AND ASSIST COMMUNITIES AT RISK FROM CATASTROPHIC WILD LAND FIRES BY PROVIDING ASSISTANCE IN THE FOLLOWING AREAS: PROVIDE COMMUNITY PROGRAMS THAT DEVELOP LOCAL CAPABILITY INCLUDING; ASSESSMENT AND PLANNING, MITIGATION ACTIVITIES, AND COMMUNITY AND HOMEOWNER EDUCATION AND ACTION; PLAN AND IMPLEMENT HAZARDOUS FUELS REDUCTION ACTIVITIES, INCLUDING THE TRAINING, MONITORING OR MAINTENANCE ASSOCIATED WITH SUCH HAZARDOUS FUELS REDUCTION ACTIVITIES, ON FEDERAL LAND, OR ON NONFEDERAL LAND FOR ACTIVITIES THAT MITIGATE THE THREAT OF CATASTROPHIC FIRE TO COMMUNITIES AND NATURAL RESOURCES IN HIGH RISK AREAS; ENHANCE LOCAL AND SMALL BUSINESS EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES FOR RURAL COMMUNITIES; ENHANCE THE KNOWLEDGE AND FIRE PROTECTION CAPABILITY OF RURAL FIRE DISTRICTS BY PROVIDING ASSISTANCE IN EDUCATION AND TRAINING; ASSIST WITH THE PREVENTION AND DETECTION OF WILDFIRES TO REDUCE THE RISK AND IMPACT TO COMMUNITIES AND THEIR VALUES.
